project.teaser: The built environment is ill-prepared for more frequent and increasingly intense climate-related extreme events. These cause severe socio-economic losses and adversely affects public health. Recent scientific and technological advances in the construction industry provide...
project.objective: The built environment is ill-prepared for more frequent and increasingly intense climate-related extreme events. These cause severe socio-economic losses and adversely affects public health. Recent scientific and technological advances in the construction industry provide timely solutions for improving the resilience of buildings for specific hazards, but these are often not cost effective or eco-friendly. There is a lack of frameworks for assessing the climate resilience, making it challenging to develop optimal solutions for multi-hazard scenarios. MULTICARE will address this challenge by developing innovative multi-criteria decision-support frameworks and providing plug & play low-carbon resilient technologies for improving the multi-hazard resilience of our built environment in a cost-effective, reliable and sustainable manner. A suite of multi-disciplinary digital services and tools will be developed for multi-hazard resilience assessment, design, operation and management across multiple scales (material, component, building, neighbourhood/district). This will enable stakeholders to make more informed decisions to select materials/solutions and build resilient supply chains, even in case of cultural heritage buildings. We will demonstrate our results in large-scale pilots (3 buildings, 4 neighbourhoods/cities) in different countries with diverse conditions. A user-centred, inclusive and participatory approach will be consistently implemented at all stages of the project for citizens engagement and for extending the durability of MULTICARE impact. To achieve the project goals, MULTICARE combines 21 partners covering the whole technical value chain required for solutions in resilient and sustainable buildings. The Consortium includes experience in social sciences, user engagement and training. The Consortium will support clustering activities with other projects aimed at sharing knowledge, experience, and raising public awareness of climate resilience.
project.title: Multi-hazard low-carbon resilient technologies and multi-scale digital services for a future-proof, sustainable & user-centred built environment
project.keywords: Resilience, Multi-hazard, Low-carbon, Low-damage, Resource efficient, Facades, Multi-criteria decision-making, Digital services, Interoperability, User-centred

article.title: Digital tools to upgrade multi-hazard resilience assessment of buildings

result.title: Framework for energy network improvement
result.description: This deliverable provides a robust decision-making framework for assessing the responsiveness of districts energy network in case of disruptive events. It involves risk analysis and cost-benefit estimations.

result.description: Dissemination and Communication Plan. It identifies project milestones suitable for outreach and relevant external events and media to enhance dissemination.

result.description: Data Management Plan (DMP). The DMP workplan includes a deliverable for open access to research data: D3.1 Open access to Research Data is due in M48.

result.title: Report on seismic testing - Acerra
result.description: Report on the experimental results obtained from the large-scale seismic testing on full-scale and/or scaled prototypes. Testing on both the as-built structure and the retrofitted building are discussed.

result.title: Multi-criteria framework for resilient components
result.description: This deliverable outlines the methodology for assessing the multi-hazard resilience of building systems and components. Specifically, the multi-criteria approach for supporting design selection.

result.title: Framework and rating system for resilient buildings
result.description: This deliverable outlines a robust decision-making framework for assessing the integrated socio-economic-environmental losses and overall resilience of a building. It involves risk analysis and cost-benefit estimations.

result.title: Catalogue of materials, systems
result.description: This deliverable provides a catalogue of resilient connections, systems, materials and components. It includes a number of representative European locations and for their related climatic and local hazards.

result.description: Training Content Creation Plan. It outlines the strategy and process for developing educational materials and resources to support training initiatives.

result.title: Method for rapid seismic loss estimation
result.description: This deliverable provides a method for the rapid estimation of building seismic damage and direct socio-economic losses. It exploits Earthquake Early Warning capabilities in earthquake detection and rapid communication.

result.title: Project Management Plan (M2)
result.description: Project Management Plan with a Gantt chart and a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), to be completed at a very early stage of the project. It should include a schedule per task, responsible partner related subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks.

result.title: Digitalization requirements and KPIs (with CDE requirements)
result.description: This deliverable provides the requirements, objectives and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the digital services to be developed and implemented in MULTICARE. Requirements are also defined for the collaborative Common Data Environment of the whole MULTICARE digital workflow (from design to operation of buildings).

result.title: Flood susceptibility estimation using randomization-based machine learning models. A case study at the Putna river basin, Romania

result.description: This deliverable provides the methodology for time-dependent estimation of travel times and isolated areas. It is based on a network-risk approach.

category.title: sustainability sciences
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/sustainability sciences

category.title: climate change adaptation
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/ecosystem-based management/climate change adaptation

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
